attributes.text: We stayed in Skalny 4 night. Hotel Skalny have very large and clean rooms, allso have a nice spa. Very tasty breakfast, se loved it. Staff was friendly and there was no problem that we arrived verry late after 1:00 at night. Location of the hotel was a bit away from the city centre but we had a car, so there was no problem for us. Anyway, we were very happy with accomodation and we would recommend this hotel.

Fabulous atmosphere in winter! Nice hotel, not in the center of Zakopane but in walking distance + clean, comfortable and warm room + very friendly staff + tasty meals + good facilities (swimming pool, sauna...) Highly recommended.

We were perhaps spoilt by our decor in the first two hotels so initial disappointment was soon forgotten. Our late arrival was catered for and we had a lovely meal off the menu. Well done to the staff. The next two days we were eating buffet, served from the warming pots. Soup absolutely gorgeous, mains and dessert not to write home about. It seems the occasion of the evening meal was a quick visit to the tro. Would deter from future visit. I enjoyed the foyer bar , which was a pleasant area to sit with the rain pouring down. The gym equipment was sufficient,the pool & saunas delightful, table football ping pong an unexpected enjoyment despite unexpected loss. The highlight was my first massage,it won't be my last. On reflection excellent stay spoilt by the evening meal.

Very nice place for families with children :) If you want just relax in very calm environment...unfortunately I can't recommend because they are many families with children which are quite load especially in swimming pool.The rest is on very good quality.

I stayed in Skalny 4 night on beginning of march. I go to Zakopne to find out what kind skiing opportunity they have. Hotel Skalny was in good condition and clean. It allso have a nice spa. Tasty breakfast included my booking. I allso had dinner there two times and I was very satisfied of the food quality. Staff was friendly but maybe not the most helpful I have met. I got what I asked but I was not offered anything. Ski room for equipment was not heated so ski boots didn't get dry there. Allso the route to ski room was so dark that I needed to use my own flashlight to find it in the dark.. Location of the hotel was a bit away from the city and there were no skibus to mountains. Anyway the price of the room and food was so cheap that owerall I am very happy and I can recommend…

We travelled as a couple and found the sleep quality here to be low. It is noisy and stuffy. It's a 35 minute walk from the centre, on poorly lit, steep and windy roads (I fell in a pothole) or a 15 minute bus ride - but there are only about 10 buses a day. PROS Ok sized rooms Nice staff with reasonable English Nice food in the restaurant (although limited choice) Close to local restaurants (10 min walk), and to mini-markets (5 min walk). Fairly regular bus route to Zakopane town centre or Harenda ski slope right outside for 3PLN each (less than £1) and the timetable is up in the lobby CONS Noisy hotel - thin walls and bad reverberation Dogs barking in nearby yards overnight No fridge No balcony in most rooms We chose this hotel as it was in the middle of quite a few ski…

The hotel is located a bit far from city center. Getting from the bus station to it would costs around 30-33 PLN, from the hotel to the city center around 23 PLN. You can always ask the receptionist to call for a taxi because in Zakopane there is no Uber or Taxify available. Hotel's restaurant was okeish, unfortunately, we didn't find any other reasonable restaurant close to the hotel (one was closed, in another one there was no menu in English), so in order to have dinner, we had to walk around 15 min to the city center's side. The hotel was much better than I expected, even though my room looked a bit old-fashioned, it was comfortable and with a great view. I didn't go to the swimming pool because I could smell it already from the distance (after chlorine). Breakfast was…

The hotel was very good... I had a New Year package with dinners included. There was a plenty of food. On two occasions there was a live music in the lobby bar, which is quite small but cute. I also enjoyed the swimming pool and sauna. The room was OK, but the furniture was quite worn out. The staff were very friendly. The hotel itself is located relatively far from the centre (Krupówki), but on other hand is quite close to Nosal ski centre and the entrance to the Tatra National Park.

-room was clean -swimming pool, jacuzzi and saunas were ideal and there never was much people so you could enjoy them fully -food was great, both breakfast and dinner We were here once before and will gladly visit again in the future.

Pleasant hotel, good prices. Good location - not far from cable station Kuznice, not far from center (all about 30-40 minutes walk), near bus station. Friendly staff, tasty food, clean rooms. Very good Recreation centre with swimming pool, jacuzzi, sauna. I recommend this hotel.

Old fashioned, but good hotel in a good place, not far from the way to Kuznice. Friendly staff, very good and tasty breakfast. In the restaurant good food for dinner, nice lobby bar. Very good pool and sauna, bubble pool. I strongly recommend this place.

In a calmer part of Zakopane, 30 minutes walk from Kuźnice (where many hiking trails and cable car to Kasprowy Wierch start). Very friendly stuff, tasty breakfasts, comfortable beds, clean, nice SPA offer.

Informations just a few in english, otherwise all in polish language. The staff was very friendly. Unfortunately we spent the days there whiele the area was overcrowded because of holidays in Poland...

Arrived at the Hotel Skalny 4 hours prior to check in time and the Hotel had our room ready and invited us to check in early. First impressions, lovely small, intimate hotel with really excellent staff. The rooms are a little old fashioned in terms of furniture but bed was really comfortable. Complimentary coffee every day in the bar during our stay. The Spa area was excellent everything you needed and very clean, in fact the general cleanliness of the room and Hotel was exemplary. The staff is what makes this Hotel, very helpful and very efficient. The food was great during the stay and really reasonable. All in all an excellent time in Zakopane, Skiing was great and the people we encountered were lovely.

location is 30 min walk from the City. building has 15 years. Spa and swimming pool are OK. good food. good proposition for economy travellers. cheap taxi and ski slopes not far from the hotel. rooms are clean.

Hotel Skalny is a marvellous hotel. With free breakfast provided and very comfortable rooms. The spa and the pool are opened from 8am - 8pm and it's very relaxing. Perfect for a getaway. Staff members are very friendly, as I am a backpacker, they provided me with a lot of information and sometimes even with their own experience!!

We stayed in Hotel Skalny for 3 days and we absolutely enjoyed it! The room was clean and with the beautiful view. There is a garden there with some play staff for kids as well as chairs and table for grown ups to relax in the sun. You can also relax and have a drink in the lounge area. There is pool, jacuzzi and spa available as well. Food was amazing-we absolutely loved the breakfast as well as dinner. Walk to krupowki took us around half an hour, with 5 year old. Plenty of parking spaces. Overall-friendly, nice, clean, welcoming place.

The hotel is just outside of the main town, but only a short walk to the town. Facilities are good with s nice spa which we all enjoyed. The pool is a decent size and in a nice environment. Hotel room range in size. But generally all well proportioned

The room was big with 2 balconies, from one was mountain view. Walk to Krupowki about 30 minutes, and about 15 to Kuznice. Squash looked like "mini" :) GOod breakfast, helpful staff. Pool and gym available till 20:00.

If your looking for a friendly, warm, homely, welcoming, happy, fun, enjoyable, exciting and fab holiday then look no further. Booking a holiday with Sunshine World and staying at the Skalny you will fulfil all the requirements listed above.

LIKES: - Location ["Near" to the center (by car/taxi 6 km from ul.Krupòwki)]; - Restaurant [Breakfasts was AWESOME, Meals (from menù) too, Pleasant waiters (of the restaurant area)]. DISLIKES: - Moquette was not so clean. - Request for mountain view, received buildings view. - Treatment from the receptionist that works the New Year's Eve evening (31/12) was UNACCEPTABLE. I've booked a room in this hotel 02/02/15, calling the same day asking if the New Year's Eve evening in case is possible to have dinner at the hotel restaurant...First answer: "YES". Then the 31/12, day for my check-in for the room, I've called the hotel at 5 pm 'cause I had some problems and I was able to arrive at the hotel at 9 pm, re-asking gently if that evening I could have dinner at the hotel…

Under the impression all rooms had balconies - our didn't! Long way from shops, restaurants, activities etc... Staff spoke good English, but were not particularly helpful Great pool, but no air conditioning

Being part of a big business group have stayed there for 4 days. Hotel has a nice traditional style with nice big rooms. Room are big and clean with some basic style furniture. Best part was the balcony overlooking the Tatra mountains. Hotel has as well Jacuzzi and spa which you can use free of charge. The only negative is that the hotel is a good 30 min walk to town but just short taxi ride. Breakfast was just on nothing special. The hotel staff could be better if they give a warm smile to their customers. Nice place to stay if your prefer to be a bit far away from the town

Wonderful hotel. The staff were professional and friendly. The facilities were brilliant. It was clean and quite. We really enjoyed out time there! Its in a very good location and in walking distance from the high street with all the restaurants- about a 20 min walk. I had some beauty treatments when there and it was very professional! The breakfast was very good with lots of choice. We had one dinner there too and it was very good.

Massage and a room for less than £50??!?! Fantastic! No bike parking, so we left the Excellent pool, jacuzzi and massages Room with Balcony good quality- annoyingly we could not the leave the electricity on whilst we were out of the room. This is daft when you need to charge comm devices, sat navs, phones etc for the next day. Is a little way out of town, which was a pain, but views were excellent Frontline girls at reception were brilliantly friendly...although I think she got scared when I tried to give her a thank you hug at 4am after a night in the town dancing! Would visit here again as excellent all round package.

Stayed here on our motorcycle tour around Tatra Mountains. Friendly hotel with good english spoken by reception staff. Rooms were medium sized, clean with everything working. Our rooms had balconies, which were great to take in the clean air and views over the town and surrounding countryside. Indoor pool and jacuzzi was great relaxation at end of the day. My friend had a massage which he said was good. Reason for the 4* is that the common areas were a bit small and without views. Perfectly adequate, but for example breakfast is in the basement. No garage for the bikes, but able to park them in sight of reception by front door, so felt very safe. The downside of this hotel as everyone says is the walk to centre of town. However, don't let this put you off as a nice walk and…

Our staying in Skalny hotel was great. There are excellent breakfast, clean room and very good saunas and pool. Personal of hotel are friendly and ready to help. Also You may receive information about Zakopane from Russian speaking guide. We'll stay in Skalny hotel without a doubt when we arrive in Zakopane next time.

We stayed at Hotel Skalny in Zakopane two nights in July 2009. The hotel is about 20 minutes walk from the center of town and it is a haven. It's set back from the street and there was virtually no noise in the evenings. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was spotless and comfortable. Breakfast was great!!! We loved it!!!!

My husband and I stayed at Hotel Skalny in Zakopane two nights in August 2012. We thought the "bad" news was that the hotel is not in the center of town, but that turned out to be the very good news! The hotel is in a residential/commercial area (with a few options for restaurants close by) about 20 minutes' walk from the hectic and overcrowded center of town. There are lots of people around--Zakopane is a destination for so many people that there are always people nearby--but the hotel is a haven. It's set back from the street and there was virtually no noise in the evenings. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was spotless and comfortable (if only average-sized), and the dining room offers a hearty breakfast. We also had dinner there one night and it was really…

After a day of hiking and dinner around Krupowki, you do not want to hike some more. It is not really a problem since busses run quite frequently in daytime but not so at night. Otherwise Skalny is an excellent choice.

Stayed at Hotel Skalny March 2011 during a ski tip. Spacious clean room. Very good heating system, plus underfloor heating in the bathroom. Staff on reception friendly & helpfull. Breakfast has all the basics, plus you can ask them to cook you eggs of your choice. Just dont ask for a omlette, as they'll serve it like a pancake with whiped cream & tinned fruit on top - which was very odd. The spa / pool was clean & we used it several times. I would say its an averge to good 3* Hotel.

We stayed at hotel skalny for three nights in June. The hotel is some distance away from the town centre, but is situated at the base of the local mountains with stunning views from our balcony and the surrounding countryside. We asked to be moved from the first room which we were allocated because of a broken blind, and this was done very quickly with the minimum of fuss. The room itself was very comfortable, quite spacious with the interior clad in wood, ski-lodge style. Bathroom was large and clean with a power-shower cubicle. The only downside was that there was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Breakfast was a standard continental-style buffet and pretty good overall. Although we didn't use the swimming pool/sauna we had a good look at them and the they…

We spent the first week of March 2010 at Hotel Skalny. The purpose of the stay was a leisure connected with plans of starting to learn our 3-year daughter to ski. As skiing hills are scatterd in whole Zakopane the location was not the most important issue. For those who do not walk I recommend to choose a place closer to Krupowki St. Overall impression is very satisfactionary. Starting with good variety of tasty food with breakfast, followed by visits to various ski places, we usually finisghed out days at Hotel Skalny. Nice restaurant offer, comfy lobby bar, clean and relaxing SPA with additional kids rooms, pool table were exactly what we needed for a nice family one week stay. One disadvantage mentioned before by somebody else : electic plugs in walls should be…

We stayed in a 2 room apartment which was spacious and simply furnished in modern style. All timber is clean cut pine which gives a warm ambience to the hotel. Service was friendly and helpful. Facilities are excellent. The location is about 20 to 25 minutes walk from Zakopane centre but taxis are cheap. There are many things to do in this recreational area of southern Poland. We opted for hiking, sightseeing and cycling (nearby bike hire was cheap) in September. In winter, snow based activities abound. We travelled from Kracow to Zakopane by train - brilliant and cheap! We liked - the hotel facilies We disliked - nothing

Very friendly hotel, nice food, nice swimming pool, nice activities for children/teenagers, nice rooms. After staying at hotel Skalny for a week in feb 2007 and feb 2008, we have just ordered our 3rd stay for feb 2010. We are a party of 5 families with children ranging from 10 to 18 years. The grown ups love this place for the relaxing atmosphere and helpfull staff. Allthough the decor is not one we would have chosen for our home, it's very peacefull and relaxing to have a coffee or a drink by the open fireplace in the bar or relaxing in the sauna and pool area after a day of skiing. The children love the gym, the pool, the billijard room and often want to have dinner at the hotel rather than in the town centre. The rooms are clean and they all (nearly) have a spacious balcony…

The main problem with this hotel is its location - about 45 minutes slog from the station (longer on the way back as it's uphill). That said, once you are there you are within sight of the Tatras and we had a splendid view from our window (The youth hostel mentioned below seemed to be closed, so the football pitch under our window remained mercifully unoccupied!) Taxis are cheap - but the drivers seemed to be in some sort of competition to see who could make the quickest time - scary. The hotel staff were fine, and helpful. There is a bar right next to reception - and an internet kiosk which is very reasonably priced. Breakfast was extremely basic, but ok, and there was a restaurant but we didn't try it. The room was basic, nothing more, and the TV reception was terrible! The…

The Hotel Skalny is a lovely 3-star hotel with well appointed rooms which are very spacious and modern bathrooms. The heated towel rails were really appreciated! The views from the hotel are lovely (even though they were obscured by rain clouds for most of our stay and we could not make use of the balcony. Our opinion is that the hotel probably deserves better than a 3-star rating. Other reviews of the hotel have mentioned its distance from the main street of Krupowki and while it is a 20 minute walk, it is by no means far away and the walk is refreshing, especially after a hearty highland meal. The hotel also has a pool, spa, sauna and massage and beauty facilities. The breakfast is buffet style and included in the room price with plenty of good food on offer. We stayed…

Booked our stay in Hotel Skalny through Sunshine World website. The hotel was everything we had hoped for. Very clean and comfortable with extremely helpful and pleasant staff. It is a short (very cheap) taxi ride out of town in a peaceful neighbourhood. The breakfast was always super and if we were too tired to go out after our days skiing there was plenty of variety in the restaurant in the evening. The bar area is pleasant and offers a cosy atmosphere for a drink before bedtime. We are an Irish family with a teenage daughter and an eight year old son and they both said it was the best holiday they have ever had! Looking forward to going back next year.

We stayed a week at the Hotel Skalny, and were very pleased overall. The room wasn't the biggest, or the plushest we've ever had, but the beds (two singles) were comfortable; the linen (bath and bed) impeccable, the room was spotless on arrival, and the daily servicing was superb. Breakfast (buffet-style) was an event in itself - English tastes were catered to with warm bread rolls, cereals & scrambled eggs; while all the northern Europeans tucked into hearty combinations of ham, cheese, cucumber, egg mayonnaise, slices of apple pie, and, one morning, what looked like green blancmange. It seemed to be ok to make a sandwich or two to take away for later on... The restaurant is open for evening meals too, which may be your preferred option if you are travelling with children. …

My group of 5 stayed at the Hotel Skalney for 3 nights on the last leg of our 2 week trip to Poland. Each member of the group (ranging in age from 27 -55) had nothing but a gleaming review of the hotel. Some of the highlights were: * Beautiful views from the back porch * Extremely helpful staff who answered all of our questions and even gave us advice on hiking, shopping, and authentic dining in the area * Heated Towel racks in the bathroom * Large showers (by Polish standards) * Extremely comfortable beds * Large breakfast buffet * Hot Tub and Pool In reading the other review for the Hotel Skalney I did not notice the thin walls or loud hostiles near by. The night time was very quiet. We were using American laptops, video cameras (playing video of the day through the…

Well, we're not long back from a 3 day stay at the Hotel Skalny, and it was an.. interesting experience. This hotel is best compared to a wolf in sheeps clothing. The hotel is fairly new, and arriving at the hotel was very efficient and looked lovely at the foot of the hills, but this hotel has a lot of "HOWEVERS".. Positives of hotels: - Gorgeous Views - Pretty New - Comfy beds - Good Spa - Clean and safe feeling So the initial views of the hotel were very positive, but scratch beneath the surface and this hotel is a bit of a nightmare. I'll tell you of our experiences in this hotel, which we will NEVER be returning to: Everything about this hotel smells of being quickly put up, not thought through and of a bit of a poor standard. Problems 1. The hotel is a very long…
